TOGAIL - Esports Concierge


3rd Place HACK-A-STARTUP Competition - Carnegie Mellon University

Background:

Hack-A-Startup 2022 (28th October - 15th November) was hosted by the Graduate Entrepreneurship Club, Undergraduate Entrepreneurship Association, and CMU Summit on US-China Innovation and Entrepreneurship at the Swartz Center for Entrepreneurship, Tepper School of Business.

Format:

Pitch your idea, hire a team, work on the idea (interviews/secondary research/domain survey) for idea validation and present it to industry leaders..


Breif Description of our idea:

Togail is revolutionizing the world of esports by connecting high-end sponsors to grassroots tournaments. These tournaments, composed of the coveted 18-34 demographic, offer daily competition with the potential for large turnouts from small prize pools. However, traditional sponsors have stayed away due to the risk involved.

On one hand, players, who make up the 34.8 million hardcore gamers in the US, face a challenge in finding the right tournament to play comfortably, as they navigate through hundreds of discord servers and brackets. On the other hand, sponsors are unaware of these tournaments and lack trust in the organizers, hindering their potential involvement.

Togail solves these problems by acting as a bridge between sponsors, tournament organizers, and players. With features like handling payouts to ensure transparency and reducing financial risk, discovering verified tournament organizers, and easily finding tournaments through the web app, Togail is making it easier for sponsors to reach out to quality organizers and for players to find the tournaments they're looking for.

On an average there are $9.2 million in prize payouts, weekly, with approximately 11% ($1 million) being from payouts under $30,000, representative of most grassroots tournaments. Togail is poised to capture this market and more, as the global esports prize payouts are estimated to reach $500 million by the end of 2022.

Togail operates on a revenue model that charges a 10% payout margin. With the growth of the esports industry, Togail is positioning itself at the forefront of this exciting and lucrative market.


Description

  • Chief Strategist | Technical Head

  • 28 October 2022 - 15 November 2022

Togail is a platform that connects high-end sponsors with grassroots esports tournaments.
It offers a solution to problems faced by both players and sponsors in the esports industry by providing transparency, reducing financial risk, and making it easier to find tournaments.
